originalText.text: Grand Central Madison is the new extension of Grand Central for LIRR trains. This was one of the most expensive transit projects in the world and took over a decade to complete. But the new terminal is beautiful. It is very deep underground and the escalator is extremely steep. The terminal is also very clean.

text.text: Grand Central Madison is the new extension of Grand Central for LIRR trains. This was one of the most expensive transit projects in the world and took over a decade to complete. But the new terminal is beautiful. It is very deep underground and the escalator is extremely steep. The terminal is also very clean.

originalText.text: Grand Central is a beautiful landmark and instrumental part of New York City. I am grateful for being able to commute from Fairfield County Connecticut to my place of work in NYC. I have a great found appreciation for the train station as it makes my life so much easier relative to commuting which is big contributor to a better work life balance. Walking through the station and looking at all the beautiful architecture is an experience in it's own right. Stop by and check it out for yourself if you can the next time you are in NYC. The lower level has some pretty good food also. Giving Grand Central five out of five stars.

originalText.text: Grant Central is an icon of New York from years past.  A wonderful and huge Hall, built with great splendor.  Windows and lights add magic to this place.  A place where many films were shot, including gangster ones ;)

text.text: Grant Central is an icon of New York from years past.  A wonderful and huge Hall, built with great splendor.  Windows and lights add magic to this place.  A place where many films were shot, including gangster ones ;)

originalText.text: Must see tourist destination. Impressive architecture and high ceilings create a grandiose atmosphere that is typical of New York. Photo opportunities at every corner. LIRR terminal is brand new and pristine.

text.text: Must see tourist destination. Impressive architecture and high ceilings create a grandiose atmosphere that is typical of New York. Photo opportunities at every corner. LIRR terminal is brand new and pristine.

originalText.text: I usually depart and arrive from Penn Station. Today I made an exception for the first time to get off at Grand Central just to see for myself. Station is very nice, clean, looks very upscale, but the last time I will get on the Long Island RR from there. First, the Long Island RR is stuffed all the way down at the bottom lower level. Secondly, entrance and exists are between 45 and 48th street Madison Avenue. Third, those escalators look like escalators to heaven. That’s how steep and long they are. Longer than the Hudson Yards escalators for anyone who knows. Last, once you make it to the mezzanine level the only option to get out onto the street level is the elevator. So, you can just image during rush hour or God forbid something happens you are stuck with only an elevator. Very different from Penn Station. Just my personal opinion and I just don’t like it.
